However, Japan was defeated before mass production could begin. After the surrender, the prototype was confiscated by American occupation authorities and was shipped to the United States.
1121.name: Type 5 Chi-Ri

19473.description: A superheavy tank with rear placement of the turret. Developed by the Krupp company in 1942, the project was discontinued in favor of more heavy tanks. No vehicles were ever manufactured.
19473.name: Pz.Kpfw. VII

4129.description: Artillery developed on the basis of the M24, with 60 vehicles actually produced out of a total of 250 ordered. The M41 did not see action in World War II, but fought in the Korean War.
4129.name: M41 HMC

17937.description: In 1935, Erich von Manstein of the German Army General Staff, in a letter to General Ludwig Beck, described the idea of building assault artillery to support attacking infantry units. Five prototypes of the zero series were manufactured in 1937. Early modifications from Ausf.A to Ausf.F/8 were produced until December 1942.
17937.name: StuG III Ausf. B

36113.description:
A deadly shadow that stalks the battlefield, hungering for its next meal. A Swiss project of a medium tank with improved combat characteristics and the ability to fight in mountainous terrain. Developed in 1953, the plans called for using the gun from the British Centurion tank. A total of two prototypes and ten vehicles were produced, but the vehicle never saw mass production.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
36113.name: Wraith Panzer 58

5425.description: Development of model 113 was started in 1963. The vehicle was conceived as an alternative to the WZ-111 and used parts and components of medium tanks. However, the project was canceled due to the development of main battle tanks.

40273.description: An assault vehicle conceived for breakthrough attacks on enemy fortifications. Development began in 1943. One of the designs, developed as a student project, was proposed at the School of Tank Technology (Chertsey, U.K.). Existed only in blueprints. This Premium tank has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
40273.name: Terrapin Mk. 1

1137.description: Developed in occupied Czechoslovakia for the Wehrmacht in 1941, the project featured sloped armor plates and enhanced armament based on the Soviet T-34. However, the project was deemed outdated and no prototypes were manufactured.
1137.name: Škoda T 24

3649.description: This experimental tank was a further development of the AMX 13. The tank underwent trials, but never entered mass production or saw service. Two vehicles were manufactured.
3649.name: Bat.-Châtillon 25 t

2561.description: This variant of the T-34 is considered a separate model because it incorporated so many modifications to the original. A total of 21,048 vehicles were produced by the end of World War II, and production continued long after the war was over.
2561.name: T-34-85

6721.description: The project of a new vehicle was suggested by engineers of the Baudet-Donon-Rousell company in June 1938. However, the design was never developed.
6721.name: BDR G1 B

19201.description: A project for a light tank with the T-100 armament. Jointly developed by Research Institute No. 100 and GSKB-47 (State Specialized Design Bureau) in the mid-1960s. The vehicle featured decent armor that could protect it from 90 mm shells (in case of frontal impact) at any distance.
19201.name: T-100 LT

54049.description:
In 1943, the Montreal Locomotive Works started mass production of the Sexton Artillery, developed on the basis of the RAM II. A total of 2,150 vehicles were produced by 1945, of which 125 were designated the Sexton I.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 35% bonus Silver earn.
54049.name: Sexton I

8017.description: This experimental tank destroyer had the gun mounted in the middle of the hull behind a gun shield. A prototype was built, but work on the vehicle was discontinued when a new tank destroyer was developed, based on the Valentine and mounting the powerful 17-pounder.
8017.name: Valentine AT

31873.description:
A prototype of the heavy tank developed for the Swedish army under the EMIL project in the 1950s. The development was preceded by deep scientific research and all required characteristics were calculated using complex formulas. Based on the calculations, a draft design was prepared in 1951, but development was discontinued in favor of later versions.
This Premium tank has a 10% XP earn rate bonus and a 50% Silver earn bonus.
31873.name: Barracuda EMIL 51

35841.description:
The Kirovets-1 project (IS-3, prototype No. 1) was developed from July through November 1944. The prototype was built at the Chelyabinsk Kirov Plant during September and October 1944. From December 18 through December 24, 1944, the vehicle underwent trials at the NIBT proving grounds in Kubinka. After it was decided to manufacture a pilot series of the modified IS-2 with a hull proposed by engineers of Plant No. 100 and Central Research Institute-48, the work on the Kirovets-1 was discontinued.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
35841.name: Scourge Kirovets-1

5153.description: The M5 Stuart entered production in April 1942. By June 1944 a total of 10,884 vehicles in two variants had been produced. The tank was used in all theaters of war.
5153.name: M5 Stuart

9473.description: Developed in October 1940, the design presented by Plant 174 was submitted for consideration. After successful trials in February and March 1941, the vehicle entered service.
9473.name: T-50

51393.description:
Conceptualization of a draft design developed at the request of General Francesco Rossi who believed that only light vehicles weighing up to 35 tons would be effective in a new war. Such an innovative design was not approved and development was discontinued when Italy joined the Standard Tank project.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
51393.name: Progetto M35 mod. 46

13473.description:
A combination of Axis and Allied machinery, the Sharpshooter is nimble and packs a reliable punch.
Though great all-rounders, Assault tanks can be at a disadvantage against specialists. They are devastating in groups, and can be used to weaken enemy footholds.
13473.name: Sharpshooter

37137.description: In 1945, Krupp announced that two multiple loaded drums had been completed. The drums and an 88 mm Pak modified by Dortmund-Hoerder Huttenverein to accept a multi-loaded drum were transferred to the Hillersleben firing range. A second was to be modified for installing a Pak 43/3 with drum in the JagdPanther. The Panzerknacker Auto has a 10% XP earn bonus and a 50% Silver earn bonus.
37137.name: Panzerknacker Auto

6449.description: The T-26 tanks were exported by the USSR to China in the late 1930s, where they saw service in the 200th Mechanized Division of the National Revolutionary Army of Kuomintang (China). During the civil war of 1946–1950, a number of vehicles were captured by the People's Liberation Army in eastern China in 1949. In 1950, they were used as a basis for the creation of at least two modifications of tank destroyers.
6449.name: T-26G FT

198401.description: Initially known as “Object 600,” the SU-122-54 was designed as a long-range tank destroyer to be built using components from the T-54 along with a 122mm main gun. Development began in 1949; production ran only from 1955 to 1957, with the number of units completed estimated between 77 and 95.
198401.name: SU-122-54 ‘56

1617.description: This variant of the M3 Lee was manufactured in the United States specifically to be supplied to the U.K., where it was designated the General Grant (Grant I).
1617.name: Grant

1169.description: Development of a new light tank for the needs of the Polish army started in 1935 at the Państwowe Zakłady Inżynieryjne (PZInż) works under the supervision of engineer Edward Habich. Foreign developments had a great impact on the design of the new light tank. It was based on the 4-ton British Vickers Carden Loyd Commercial light tank. The technical design was developed in December 1936, and the first prototype of the PZInż.140 tank was built. The vehicle underwent trials from the fall of 1937 through the spring of 1939, but eventually did not see mass production.
1169.name: 4TP

3585.description: Artillery on the chassis of the T-34-85 and SU-85, with a total of 2,495 vehicles produced from September 1944 through June 1945.
3585.name: SU-100

57937.description: Work on the new heavy tank started in the U.K. in 1951. It was planned to provide for the armament interchangeability of the FV4201 Chieftain and the American T95 tanks (including turrets). The project was discontinued because of issues with crew training, as the members of the vehicle crew would have had to operate two different artillery and gun control systems at once. This Premium tank has a 5% bonus XP earn.
57937.name: T95/FV4201 Chieftain

201729.description: Josef Kotin, the prominent engineer behind the IS tank series, was also responsible for the development of Object 268 after World War II. This vehicle married a 152mm M-64 gun to components from the T-10. Although the prototype revealed in 1956 performed well, the appearance of the U.S. M60 and British Chieftain vehicles led the Soviet Union to abandon Object 268 in pursuit of more sophisticated and efficient designs.
201729.name: Object 268 ‘56

51345.description:
A variant of the Pz.Kpfw. V Panther Ausf. G, the most massively produced modification of the German Panther tank.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 25% bonus Silver earn.
51345.name: Wojtek Pz.Kpfw. V Ausf. G

16129.description: Developed on the basis of the SU-14. In 1936 a prototype was manufactured and tested. In 1937 the project supervisor was purged and the project was cancelled. The prototype was shipped to Kubinka for storage. In 1941, during the Battle of Moscow, the SU-14-1 was used for long-range bombardment.
16129.name: SU-14-1

55073.description:
A light wheeled caterpillar vehicle with machine guns was developed for the U.S. cavalry. Trials of the first prototype started in April 1937 and continued until 1939. However, the T7 was later discontinued in favor of track-type vehicles.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
55073.name: T7 Combat Car

9041.description: A tank destroyer, developed from 1944 through 1945 on the basis of the Tetrarch light tank. The project was canceled when World War II ended.
9041.name: Alecto

5281.description:
Despite its lower profile, Slapjack can deliver hits with a speed and intensity that enemies may find surprising.
Defenders are heavily armored fighters. High defense and HP means they can hold their ground, but this comes at the expense of mobility.
5281.name: Slapjack

36865.description:
A proposed light vehicle developed by Lieutenant Provornov in the summer of 1942. No prototypes were manufactured.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
36865.name: Father Frost LTP

202785.description: By the end of the 1950s, the differences between the Soviet T-54/55 series of tanks and the M48 Patton were clear. Any updates to the M48 would need stronger armor and greater firepower to hold their own in battle, along with improved fuel efficiency and range. Enter the M60, which featured reinforced armor and the new 105mm M68 cannon. The M60 series became the first true U.S. main battle tank during the Cold War and was produced in considerable numbers.
202785.name: M60 '61

881.description: The V-8-H was a further development of the PS-II-b medium tank and the P-II-b light infantry tank. The vehicle underwent trials from the summer of 1937 through the spring of 1938. In the fall of 1938, additional trials were held. After all faults were removed, the tank saw service under the designation ST vz.39. The vehicle never entered mass production.
881.name: ST vz. 39

14497.description:
This union of American, Soviet, and German engineering gives rise to an excellent all-rounder.
Though great all-rounders, Assault tanks can be at a disadvantage against specialists. They are devastating in groups and can be used to weaken enemy footholds.
This Premium vehicle has a 20% bonus XP earn and a 56% bonus Silver earn.
14497.name: Skullcap

53505.description:
Developed together with the T-126 at Factory No. 174 during the summer of 1940. Vehicle development was suspended during the preliminary design phase and then discontinued due to problems with the V-3 diesel engine.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 31% bonus Silver earn.
53505.name: T-127

7473.description: A project for a tank destroyer based on the Type 62 tank also known as WZ-131. The vehicle was developed in 1963. Like the basic vehicle, this tank destroyer was designed to fight in the mountainous and boggy areas of South China with multiple bridges. There is no information about any produced prototypes.
7473.name: WZ-131G FT

10769.description: Work on the VK4501(P) was initiated in April 1942. The prototype was developed immediately and entered production without any trials. In August, production was discontinued, with a total of five vehicles manufactured.
10769.name: Tiger (P)

130225.description:
Through the Military Assistance Program (MAP) established after World War II, Norway received a number of M24 Chaffee tanks from the U.S. The tanks met Norway’s military needs for several years, but by the 1970s, the increased strength of Soviet vehicles moved Norway to update its fleet. The M24’s 75mm gun was replaced with the French 90mm D/925, and the gas engine was upgraded to a 6V-53T diesel engine. These plus other updates produced the NM-116, which Norway used into the 1990s.
This Premium vehicle has a 20% bonus XP earn, a 55% bonus Silver earn and a 10% bonus Crew XP earn.
130225.name: NM-116

4609.description: Produced in greater numbers than any other tank of the Red Army during the pre-war period, with 11,218 vehicles in four main modifications built from 1931 through 1941.
4609.name: T-26

18433.description: Development of the light tank project was started in early 1944 at Factory No. 174. The project was canceled during the design phase and the phase of setting tactical and technical requirements.
18433.name: LTTB

58961.description: A light tank project with an oscillating turret for providing anti-tank defense behind infantry positions. No prototypes were built, and it existed only in blueprints.
58961.name: Manticore

5905.description: First saw combat in the Battle of Kursk (Operation Citadel) and went on to fight on all fronts. Manufactured from February 1943 through July 1944, with a total production of 675 artillery and 159 ammunition carriers.
5905.name: Wespe

14929.description: Experimental tank on the basis of the Centurion medium tank. The vehicle was in development from 1956 through 1959. Never saw mass production. Technical decisions and innovations implemented on the FV4202 became the basis for the FV4201 Chieftain.
14929.name: FV4202

10065.description: Conceived as an assault breakthrough tank, this design was completed by June 10, 1943. No complete prototypes were built. However, some parts and components of the AT7 were used in the A39 Tortoise.
10065.name: AT 7

1217.description: Development of this vehicle started at the end of 1940, but due to difficulties in finding a suitable engine, the first prototype was manufactured only at the beginning of 1942. Mass production was launched in 1943 in Turin. After Italy's capitulation in the autumn of 1943, the tank entered service under the designation Panzerkampfwagen P40 737(i) and was used by the German reserve divisions as permanent fire positions. A total of 100 vehicles were produced.
1217.name: P26/40

37889.description:
The SU-130PM is a project for a tank destroyer with an open cabin based on the SU-100PM. Unlike its predecessor, this modification featured a more powerful 130 mm gun that required specific changes to be introduced in the vehicle design.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
37889.name: Shashka SU-130 PM

7201.description: The most powerful American tank destroyer. The M36 was developed on the chassis of the M10A1 and M10, with a total of 2,324 vehicles manufactured from November 1943 through September 1945.
7201.name: M36 Jackson

17953.description: A further development of the T37 experimental tank. Underwent trials in 1949. In 1950, the contract for mass production was signed. The tank was produced by the Cadillac Motor Car Division, a division of General Motors.
17953.name: M41 Walker Bulldog

15521.description:
A fusion of French and Chinese engineering, the SpyGlass excels in the arenas of agility and speed.
Scouts use speed and camouflage to their advantage. Keep moving, and use cover to keep enemies in your team’s sights.
15521.name: SpyGlass

54529.description:
Developed in 1936 by the Vickers-Armstrong company, with a total of 177 vehicles in two basic modifications, the Tetrarch Mk I and the Tetrarch Mk ICS, manufactured from 1941 through 1942. In 1942, twenty vehicles were delivered to the U.S.S.R. under Lend-Lease, of which 19 fought on the Eastern Front until October 1943.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 9% bonus Silver earn.
54529.name: Tetrarch

66321.description: The reconnaissance tank destroyer was being developed by Hotchkiss and Klöckner-Humboldt-Deutz companies from 1956 through 1962 in order to increase the anti-tank capability of recon tank battalions. A 90-mm anti-tank gun was planned to be mounted on the new vehicle. The project was eventually declined. The number of prototypes built is unknown. This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
66321.name: Fast Track Spähpanzer

31105.description:
The development of an advanced tank for the Swedish army was performed by Sven Berge. The first drafts of the unique vehicle were developed in 1956. By 1961, the design of the new vehicle was finalized, and a wooden prototype was built. Later, the first Strv S1 prototype was built and used to test a new type of suspension, which allowed for vertical aiming of the rigidly mounted gun. The Strv S2 prototype was developed by the end of 1962. Both prototypes became the basis for the mass production of the Strv 103 tank.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
31105.name: Stark Strv S1

1473.description: The P.43 is an Italian project medium tank developed in the mid-1940s. Only a wooden 1:10-scale prototype was built.
1473.name: P.43

10497.description: Heavy assault tank. Developed on the basis of the KV-1 in January 1940, with a total of 334 vehicles manufactured from 1940 through 1941. The KV-2 tanks were used in action in 1941, with most of the vehicles lost the same year.
10497.name: KV-2

5633.description: A "Medium Triplex" artillery. Development started in 1934, but was soon suspended. After a pause, development resumed in 1939, but the vehicle never entered mass production.
5633.name: SU-8

40481.description:
From the murky depths emerges a beast made from the very swamp it inhabits. The M6A2E1 was a further development of the T1 and M6 heavy tanks. Developed in August 1944, the vehicle mounted a larger turret and a 105 mm gun. It never saw mass production. 
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 67% bonus Silver earn.
40481.name: Bog Horror

59985.description: Becky Lynch edition. The FV1066 Senlac is a variant of a light tank developed in the 1960s. Based on the requirements of the General Staff, the vehicle was supposed to boast superior maneuverability and mobility compared to the American M24 Chaffee tank. The project featured the oscillating turret. Existed only in blueprints. This Premium tank has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
59985.name: Becky Lynch FV1066 Senlac

6929.description: Developed from June 1942 through July 1944, with two prototypes produced, only one of which received a turret and armament.
6929.name: Maus

57121.description:
The first M46 tanks that landed in Korea belonged to the 6th Medium Tank Battalion. The vehicles, known as “Ripper Pattons”, were later allocated to the 8th Army and used by infantry forces as support vehicles. However, in 1950 and 1951, the M46 also saw action in several tank battles. By June 1951, the front line had stabilized and the mobile stage of combat action had finished, so the army started to use the vehicles in an artillery role. Along with other U.S. tanks that fought in Korea, M46 tanks were painted with "Tiger Face" markings.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 57% bonus Silver earn.
57121.name: M46 Patton KR

26433.description:
In 1946, the AMX company presented this design for a new vehicle. Its powerful engine and light weight would have made the vehicle highly mobile, and the 90 mm gun was equipped with a mechanical ammunition system for a high rate of fire. However, the large dimensions of the vehicle, its thin armor, and the complexity of the design made it unappealing, and the project never advanced to the prototype stage.
This Premium vehicle has a 75% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
26433.name: AMX CDC Black Edition

61953.description:
An experimental medium tank developed in 1945 on the basis of the T-44 tank. Unlike the T-44, the T-44-100 featured the 100 mm LB-1 gun mounted in a newly designed turret, and slat side armor. Only two vehicles were manufactured.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
61953.name: T-44-100

3377.description: Development was started in 1957. The vehicle was a lightweight version of the Type 59 tank and was designed to fight in the mountainous and boggy terrain of South China. The first prototype was built in 1962. Later the vehicle underwent modernization.
3377.name: WZ-131

62577.description: A developmental variant of the Czechoslovakian post-war light tank that featured an autoloader gun. It existed only in blueprints. The vehicle was similar to the T17 light tank project. This Premium tank has a 10% bonus XP earn and 50% bonus Silver earn.
62577.name: General T 27

16545.description:
Excellent speed and agility values make T.A.N.K. a formidable foe in close-range combat.
Scouts use speed and camouflage to their advantage. Keep moving, and use cover to keep enemies in your team’s sights.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 40% bonus Silver earn.
16545.name: T.A.N.K.

155937.description: In 1950, the U.S. Army found itself in dire need of new armor. The outbreak of the Korean War and the need to counter the proliferation of T-34/85 tanks pushed the Army to charge forward with a new tank design. It took the vetted M46 chassis, combined it with the experimental but more powerful T42 turret and gun, and rushed the design into mass production, resulting in the M47 Patton. However, the M47 Patton arrived in Korea late in the war. As a result, many of these tanks were sent to European allies as a shield against possible invasion or used throughout the Cold War in training. Few saw actual combat.
155937.name: M47 Patton

56849.description: The predecessor of engineering vehicles, developed on the basis of the American M48 post-war medium tank. Equipped with the M8A1 dozer blade, these vehicles entered service in Bundeswehr engineering units and were used until the late 1990s in territorial forces, but with demounted guns. A total of 53 vehicles saw service in Bundeswehr. This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
56849.name: Dread Dozer M48A2 Räumpanzer

41505.description:
A project of an airborne light tank developed by the Aircraft Armaments as a replacement for the M41. The design incorporated many innovations. Two prototypes were manufactured, which underwent trials at Aberdeen Proving Ground. In June 1958, the project was canceled.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
41505.name: Falcon T92

10817.description: The first design project of a heavy tank destroyer on the basis of the M4. Development was started in 1946. The configuration of the vehicle bore a strong resemblance to the Jagdpanther. Existed only in blueprints.
10817.name: AMX AC mle. 46

154369.description: As the world’s first infantry fighting vehicle, the BMP-1 redefined armored warfare and became a symbol of Cold War-era conflict. Unlike the open-top armored personnel carriers of World War II, the BMP-1 featured a fully enclosed, all-welded steel construction with ports that allowed infantry to open fire on the battlefield without leaving the vehicle’s protection. It also was armed with a 73mm gun and an AT-3A Sagger anti-tank guided missile system and fitted with full nuclear, biological, and chemical (NBC) filtration. Additionally, it was completely amphibious. The BMP-1 entered service in 1966.
154369.name: BMP-1

12113.description: An artillery variant on the basis of the A45 Conqueror. It was planned to mount either a 105 mm, 140 mm, or 152 mm howitzer in a closed armored cabin. The vehicle existed only in blueprints.
12113.name: FV207

31617.description:
A modification of the 38M Toldi I light tank. The vehicle was named after the Hungarian knight Miklos Toldi and featured improved armor and increased ammunition capacity compared to previous versions. Approximately 12 vehicles were manufactured during World War II.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
31617.name: 43 M. Toldi III

36097.description:
A heavy artillery on the hull of the KV-1S tank, with a total of 671 vehicles built from February through December 1943.
This Premium vehicle has a 20% bonus XP earn and a 35% bonus Silver earn.
36097.name: Slayer SU-152

31745.description:
This heavy tank destroyer on the basis of the ISU-122S was developed in 1944, with a prototype built in October. The 130 mm S-26 gun, based on the B-13 naval gun, was mounted on the ISU-122S. The vehicle underwent automotive and firing trials by 1945, but penetration characteristics were inferior to those of the 122 mm guns, and the war was drawing to a close, so the vehicle never entered service. 
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
31745.name: ISU-130

44097.description: Andre the Giant edition. A variant of the AMX M4 heavy tank based on the Project 141 with reinforced frontal  armor. It was planned to enhance the frontal armor by mounting a 280 mm armor plate. Existed only in blueprints. This Premium tank has a 5% bonus XP earn.
44097.name: Andre the Giant AMX M4 mle. 54

897.description: Development was started in 1936 by the Landsverk company. The new vehicle incorporated some elements of the L-60 light tank. In 1939, Hungary took an interest in the project. By the time the first prototype was produced in 1940, Hungary decided to develop their own medium tank on the basis of the Škoda T-21. Later, some technical solutions were applied in the development of the Strv m/42 tank.
897.name: Lago

235009.description:
Faced with the production problems and high cost of the complex T-64 tank, the Soviet Union initiated the Object 172 project to develop a new main battle tank that would retain the T-64’s best features, including its light weight, 125mm cannon, and use of an autoloader to reduce crew size. The result, the T-72, was considered an effective "wartime production" version of the T-64. It became the most-used tank throughout the Warsaw Pact from the 1970s to the 1990s.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP, a 25% bonus Crew XP, and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
235009.name: T-72 Ural

56577.description:
A proposed light vehicle developed by Lieutenant Provornov in the summer of 1942. No prototypes were manufactured.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
56577.name: LTP

156961.description: At the same time the troubled M60A2 was in production, development was being done on the next upgrade to the M60A1’s design: the M60A3. Unlike the A2, the A3 retained its predecessor’s 105mm gun. Added to the armament were several enhancements, including a ballistic computer, a laser rangefinder, a thermal gun sleeve, and thermal night vision equipment. The M60A3 remained in front-line service with the U.S. military until 1997, almost twenty years after the first units rolled off the line.
156961.name: M60A3

60737.description: This Panther modification was produced from August 1943 to June 1944. The Ausf. A modification featured a new turret and bow gun ball mounting. The observation devices also went through modernization. A total of 2,300 vehicles with these modifications were produced. In 1944, after the Allied landing in Normandy, some vehicles were captured by the French Armed Forces and used in combat against the Germans. This Premium tank has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 25% bonus Silver earn.
60737.name: Bretagne Panther

1297.description: This famous tank was produced from January 1943 through April 1945, with a total of 5,796 vehicles built plus eight vehicles built on the F series chassis.
1297.name: Panther

7681.description: Artillery on the chassis of the T-26. Produced in Leningrad at the end of 1941, with a total of 12 or 14 vehicles built, three of which remained in service until 1944.
7681.name: SU-26

11841.description: An artillery prototype based on the Batignolles-Chatillon 25t manufactured in 1954. Never entered mass production.
11841.name: Bat.-Châtillon 155 58

52737.description:
The most famous light tank of World War II, with a total of 13,859 vehicles manufactured from 1941 through September 1943. 1,576 tanks (mostly of the M3A1 version) were supplied to the U.S.S.R. under Lend-Lease, and many more to the British.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
52737.name: M3 Light

8977.description: Developed by the Krupp company in 1943 and 1944. A scale model of the artillery was built, but no full-size prototypes were ever produced.
8977.name: G.W. Panther

59169.description:
Successful combat use of the assault M4A3E2 tank with enhanced armor spurred the decision to create a similar modification of the M26. Chrysler started production of the improved vehicles in July 1945. Trials revealed that it was necessary to reduce its off-road speed to avoid damage to the suspension. A total of 27 vehicles were manufactured to take part in trials and experiments.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 57% bonus Silver earn.
59169.name: Patriot T26E5

13137.description: The tank destroyer prototype was created on the basis of the Centurion medium tank. Developed for use in combat against heavy tanks of that period, including the IS-3.
13137.name: FV4004 Conway

7457.description: The Long Tom and its successor, the M43, became the most powerful Allied artillery. The M40 fought in the battle for Cologne in 1945. Both vehicles were used during the Korean War.
7457.name: M40/M43

237569.description:
Developed in 1975 to support Soviet airborne troops, Object 934 was designed to be an air-mobile, amphibious light tank. Among its features were a 100mm rifled gun, hydropneumatic suspension, and 400-hp engine located in the rear. Object 934 was never developed beyond the prototype phase, but it is believed to have influenced the design of the 2S25 Sprut-SD tank destroyer.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn, a 60% bonus Silver earn and a 10% bonus Crew XP earn.
237569.name: Object 934

10273.description: The vehicle was intended as a self-propelled infantry support gun on the basis of the M5 tank. The M8A1 variant featured a modified turret and upgraded armament. From September 1943 through January 1944, a total of 1,778 vehicles were manufactured.
10273.name: M8A1

6705.description: In 1943, the National Revolutionary Army of Kuomintang received 48 light M3A3 and M5A1 tanks under the USA Lend-Lease program. Some vehicles were captured by the People's Liberation Army. Following the end of the civil war, it was decided to improve the firepower of these tanks. It was planned to mount Soviet anti-tank guns, but since the export of the Soviet T-34-85 tanks had begun, the issue of modernization became outdated. No prototypes were built.
6705.name: M3G FT

47377.description:
The vehicle was proposed as a further development of the Ru 251 and primarily intended for export, particularly to Mexico. This variant inherited the same armor and armament from its predecessor, but featured an elongated hull and an additional support roller. The vehicle existed only in blueprints.
This vehicle has a 10% XP earn bonus and a 50% Silver earn bonus.
47377.name: HWK 30

1809.description: A light, low-profile tank destroyer designed according to General Heinz Guderian's specifications. The Hetzer was produced from April 1944 to May 1945, with a total of 2,584 vehicles manufactured.
1809.name: Hetzer

59393.description:
This fictional T-34-85 tank, identified as Number 102 of the 1st Tank Brigade of the Polish Army, was featured in the Polish TV series Four Tank-Men and a Dog. In reality, T-34-85s were produced in Poland in the 1950s at the Bumar Labedy plant, located in Gliwice. The Polish variant was slightly modified from the Soviet tank of the late-war period.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 25% bonus Silver earn.
59393.name: T-34-85 Rudy

1329.description: The NC-2 project (commercial name NC-31) was a modification of the Renault FT-17 tank featuring a soft ride suspension and a Kegresse-Hinstin fanged rubber track. These features, along with an upgraded engine, gave an increased top speed of 16 km/h. A total of 15 vehicles of this type were exported to China.
1329.name: Renault NC-31

13825.description: The T-62 entered service in 1961. Initial units lacked an anti-aircraft machine gun; this was remedied with the T-62A variant, which featured a 12.7mm DShK gun attached to the gun loader’s cupola. Although the T-62 remained in production until 1975 and served as the primary Soviet main battle tank throughout the 1970s, production of the T-62A ceased in 1962 in favor of other variants.
13825.name: T-62A

8705.description: Developed on the chassis of the IS-7 by the design bureaus of the Kirov Plants in Chelyabinsk and Leningrad. The project was launched in 1947, but was canceled while still in the design phase.
8705.name: Object 261

10001.description: The vehicle was intended as a standard light tank of the Panzerwaffe and a basis for anti-aircraft tanks and vehicles able to traverse any terrain and railroad tracks. Existed only in blueprints.
10001.name: VK 28.01

17153.description: A prototype of this medium tank was developed from 1953 through 1957 to replace the T-54. Several prototypes were manufactured. Later, Soviet authorities wanted a tank with greater nuclear survivability and firepower. As a result, the project was discontinued in 1961, and the decision was made to develop the Object 432.
17153.name: Object 430

14161.description: Created in 1942 based on the extended chassis of the Cromwell. One definite advantage of the new vehicle was its 17-pounder gun, which was the most powerful British gun at that time. This allowed the tank destroyer to effectively hit the enemy at distances of up to 1,000 meters. However, the vehicle had a large silhouette and the chassis was overloaded. A total of about 200 vehicles were built.
14161.name: Challenger

25921.description:
Development was started on a special variant of the FCM 50 t in December 1945. The vehicle was conceived as a replacement for the AMX 50 t and combined features typical of the pre-war French tank-construction industry as well as German innovations. The vehicle was to be equipped with an additional container trailer, equipment for underwater driving, and a demountable mine clearer.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 45% bonus Silver earn.
25921.name: FCM 50 t Liberté

41985.description:
During 1956 and 1957, the Military Armored Forces Academy developed a speculative design for a new loading system on the IS-3 and T-10 heavy tanks. The IS-3 variant featured a double-row ammo rack with an automatic loading system. The crew was reduced to three members: the commander, gunner, and driver. The turret was redesigned in order to accommodate the loading mechanism. The vehicle existed only in blueprints.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
41985.name: Stockade Obj. 703 Auto

11297.description: A tank destroyer with a rotating gun turret. It was an early modification of heavy artillery and was intended to fight on the Siegfried Line.
11297.name: T28 Prototype

113.description: This light, wheeled caterpillar tank was developed on the chassis of the Hanomag WD-50 tractor. The vehicle never saw service as it was deemed obsolete after the results of trials. Several vehicles, in three variations, were manufactured, three of which were supplied to Italy and the U.S.S.R. As of the time of the German occupation, the only vehicle left in Czechoslovakia was used as a monument.
113.name: Kolohousenka

20481.description: The IS-2Sh (IS-M) was a project for the significant modification of the IS-2 proposed by N. F. Shashmurin at Kirov Factory No. 100 in early 1944. The design featured a long-barrel 122 mm gun and a rear placement of the fighting compartment. The project was discontinued in favor of the IS-6 (Object 252).
20481.name: IS-M

58625.description:
For the armies of World War II, sending captured vehicles into service was fairly commonplace. There were unconfirmed reports of a German unit refitting a captured T-34-85 with an 88 mm gun. Allegedly, this tank saw action with the 7th Panzer Division in East Prussia. Hence, the concept for the T-34-88 was born.
This Premium vehicle has a 50% bonus XP, 2% bonus Free XP, and a 20% bonus Crew XP earn.
58625.name: T-34-88

159009.description: The U.S. military’s continued search for an acceptable design for an air-mobile armored vehicle led to the development of the M551 Sheridan, which began in 1959. Key to its design was to be the 152mm gun, which would fire cannon rounds as well as Shillelagh guided missiles. The tank experienced recoil upon firing, however; additionally, the all-aluminum hull provided little protection against ground mines. Although its design made it unpopular during the Vietnam conflict, the M551 Sheridan nevertheless remained in service into the 1990s.
159009.name: M551 Sheridan

62785.description:
A heavy tank that was originally known as Project 141. Since France needed modern heavy tanks, development started immediately after World War II. Existed only in blueprints.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
62785.name: AMX M4 mle. 49

32097.description:
One of the first Japanese post-war tanks was developed on the basis of U.S. vehicles, taking into consideration Japanese terrain, rail network specifications, and the smaller stature of Japanese tankers. This variant prototype featured a shortened suspension and a larger hull height. A total of two prototypes were built.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
32097.name: Senshi STA-2

1409.description: In the early 1950s, the Centurion medium tank entered service in the Swedish army, yet a lighter and more maneuverable vehicle was required. It was decided to modernize the old Strv m/42 vehicles by equipping them with a new turret and armament. The tank received a new name, Strv 74. A total of 225 vehicles were manufactured from 1957 through 1960. The Swedish army continued to use the vehicle until the end of 1984.
1409.name: Strv 74

5457.description: A further development of the Cromwell cruiser tank, this British tank saw service in World War II. A total of 1,186 vehicles were manufactured from September 1944 through late 1945.
5457.name: Comet

9729.description:
The designs of the T-50 were submitted by the Construction Bureau of the Kirov Plant (Leningrad) and Plant 174. The design introduced by the Kirov Plant was more difficult to implement. The distinctive features of the vehicle were its hull shape and horseshoe-shaped radiator.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 40% bonus Silver earn.
9729.name: T-50-2

13889.description: In 1952, with the launch of the AMX-50-120 tank project, the French discontinued development of the AMX-50 Foch tank destroyer. A tank destroyer with the same 120 mm gun armament was thought to be unnecessary. There were attempts to upgrade the main gun to 155 mm, but these efforts were abandoned as France made moves to adopt standardized NATO equipment.
13889.name: AMX 50 Foch (155)

18177.description: A proposed lightweight version of the T-54 medium tank. Development was started in May 1949. Compared to its series-produced predecessor, the tank had better performance and maneuverability. Therefore, the tank was planned to replace the T-54 in accomplishing complicated missions. However, the T-54 tank of 1949 was improved and mass produced, and the lightweight version was canceled while still in the design phase.
18177.name: T-54 ltwt.

11025.description: An experimental tank destroyer based on the prototype of the VK 3001(H) heavy tank. Only two vehicles were manufactured, which fought on the Eastern Front. The tank destroyer was designated as "Sturer Emil' (German for "Stubborn Mule") due to frequent breakdowns.
11025.name: Sturer Emil

61217.description:
This vehicle project, using the chassis of the T24 light tank, was proposed in July 1943. The vehicle was to feature the 90 mm gun from the M36 tank destroyer. The U.S. Armed Forces requested the completion of trials and improvements to the chassis before converting the vehicle to a tank destroyer, but the program was discontinued in August 1943, in spite of successful trials by the T24 tank. No prototypes were built. 
This Premium vehicle has a 40% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
61217.name: T78

15185.description: As larger and more powerful Soviet tanks became known, it was decided a replacement for the Centurion was needed. Design work began in 1958 and it was accepted for service in 1963. When introduced, the Chieftain was the best armed and armored tank available to NATO forces, although early versions suffered engine issues. The Chieftain underwent various improvements and variants until its replacement by Challenger 1 in the 1980s. It saw exportation and service in the Middle East where some remain in operation.
15185.name: Chieftain Mk. 6

3425.description: The first tank developed in Japan after World War II. It was developed from 1954 through 1961 on the basis of the American M47 tank. The dimensions of the vehicle were decreased and the armor was reduced. As a result, the tank was lighter and complied with the requirements of the Japanese armed forces.
3425.name: Type 61

64017.description:
The German modification of the M41A1 Walker Bulldog U.S. light tank. Major changes were introduced to the 76 mm M32 gun, which was reamed out to 90 mm and shortened by 425 mm.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 40% bonus Silver earn.
64017.name: leKpz M 41 90 mm

31825.description:
Snakebite is a training version of the Cromwell developed during 1941 and 1942 by BRC&W. A total of 1,070 Cromwell vehicles were mass-produced from late 1943 through 1945. They were extensively used by the British army in the Northwest Europe Campaign of 1944–1945.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 25% bonus Silver earn.
31825.name: Cromwell Snakebite

3985.description: The B.U.G.I. uses the first letters of the last names of the engineers who developed this project (Bujnowicz, Ulrych, Grabski, and Iwanicki). The engineers took the concept of the KSUS II medium tank but adjusted the new vehicle to feature a one-turret design. The project was sent for consideration during the Grudziądz conference in 1938–1939. The project was finalized in May 1939 in the Armed Forces Training Center in Modlin. In mid-August 1939, the engineering group presented the vehicle concept and blueprints. However, further development was discontinued due to World War II.
3985.name: B.U.G.I.

59649.description:
This heavy assault gun, built on the basis of the IS tank, was effective against German heavy tanks as well as fortifications. The prototype was built at the Chelyabinsk Kirov Plant in April 1944 and the vehicle entered service in August of that year. A total of 675 vehicles were manufactured in 1944 and 1945.
This Premium vehicle has a 20% bonus XP earn and a 35% bonus Silver earn.
59649.name: ISU-122S

63809.description:
After the war, the French Army found itself in possession of a large number of M24 Chaffee light tanks. Experience had proven that the American 75 mm M6 gun, while versatile as both an anti-armor and infantry support weapon, was woefully inadequate at penetrating late-war armor. In order to capitalize on the inventory of Chaffee tanks, the French experimented with adding the new, high velocity 75 mm SA50 gun (believed to be based on the Panther’s 7.5 cm KwK 42 L/70) and the AMX-13’s radical oscillating turret and autoloader in order to improve the anti-armor capability of the now aging Chaffee. The result was the AMX Chaffee. Beyond the prototype, none of these tanks were ever made.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 20% bonus Crew XP earn.
63809.name: AMX Chaffee

1393.description: A further development of the medium T-24 tank, this vehicle was developed for the German Army in 1942. The project was deemed outdated and no prototypes were manufactured.
1393.name: Škoda T 25

10753.description: The design was developed at Factory No. 92 by engineers V.A. Ganin and A.S. Chasovnikov. The new tank was intended as an upgraded version of the unsatisfactory heavy tanks of that time. Existed only in blueprints.
10753.name: ST-I

15393.description: A medium tank with an oscillating turret and automatic loading. Developed on the basis of the M48 tank in the mid-50s. Two prototypes were built. However, during trials, automatic loading proved faulty and its development was discontinued in 1957.
15393.name: T54E1

14913.description: Developed by Hubert Clermont from 1940 through 1942, during the German occupation of France. Some elements of the SOMUA S35 medium tank and of the experimental G1R infantry tank were incorporated in the new vehicle. It was hoped that development would be continued after the liberation of the country, but by 1944, the project was deemed outdated.
14913.name: SARL 42

3729.description: A proposed project of a medium tank, developed in the engine department of the National Engineering Works factory (Dział Silnikowy PZInż) in the late 1930s in Poland. This vehicle represented a further development of the 10TP tank and was supposed to feature the Christie suspension, enhanced armor, and stronger armament. Most components of the tank were destroyed during the bombing of Warsaw industrial areas in 1939.
3729.name: DS PZInz

1073.description: In 1954, the Chinese government considered the possibility of launching production of the T-34-85 in China. At the same time, Chinese engineers proposed an alternative project: the T-34-1. While based on the T-34-85, the T-34-1's transmission compartment and suspension were to be rearranged, reducing its overall weight and giving it a lower hull. In 1954, several designs of the vehicle, with varying turrets and armament, were developed. However, a prototype was never built.
1073.name: T-34-1

12049.description: The E 100 was conceived as the basis for an artillery, an anti-aircraft vehicle, and a tank destroyer. However, its development was never started.
12049.name: Jagdpanzer E 100

62241.description: The design was developed in June 1954. Based on the latest technology and a long development cycle, the vehicle was supposed to replace the M48. Work on the design was carried out until January 1955, and elements of the vehicle were used in the subsequent T95 project. This tank has a bonus 50% Silver earn rate and a bonus 10% XP earn rate.
62241.name: TL-1 LPC

13089.description: In 1954, a conference on future heavy tanks was held in Detroit. Alongside other advanced projects, the Chrysler Corporation suggested a new tank on the basis of the TS-31 project. The main condition was that the tank should fit the Bern national tunnel. Several construction variants were considered. However, the project was canceled.
13089.name: T110E4

32129.description: Developed by the Swedish company, Landsverk, for the Swiss Armed Forces. The tank was supposed to feature a Swiss copy of the British 20-pounder tank gun. A full-size prototype was produced to test the developed solutions, but all activities were discontinued in favor of the 30-ton class vehicle. No metal prototype was produced. This vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn rate and a 50% bonus Silver earn rate.
32129.name: Draugen Lansen C

63537.description: The upgraded version of the 121 Chinese medium tank, developed in the 1960s. Unlike the prototype, the 121B was equipped with a modern 105-mm rifled gun, improved suspension, and reinforced front armor. The vehicles of this modification were equipped with infrared lamps and a laser rangefinder. The 121B aiming system had a higher firing accuracy than that of the Type 59. This Premium vehicle has a 5% bonus XP earn.
63537.name: 121B

32849.description:
Developed starting in 1944 by English Electric as a possible replacement for the A43 Black Prince. Some components were unified with the A41 Centurion. In 1948, trials of a prototype were started which mounted a Centurion Mk. II turret and a 17-pounder gun. Due to changes in Armored Forces policy and doctrine, development proceeded no further. However, the design later served as a basis for several post-war heavy tanks.
This Premium vehicle has a 75% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
32849.name: FV201 (A45) Black Edition

27201.description:
A heavy tank that was originally known as Project 141. Since France needed modern heavy tanks, development started immediately after World War II. Existed only in blueprints.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
27201.name: HMH AMX M4 mle. 49

52353.description:
In the mid 1950s, Sweden purchased approximately 240 Centurion Mk. 3 and Mk. 5 tanks from Great Britain. In the Swedish army, the vehicles were designated Strv 81. They remained in service until the early 2000s and underwent several modernizations throughout service.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 60% bonus Silver earn.
52353.name: Strv 81

16417.description: A 155 mm artillery on the chassis of the M41 light tank. Developed from 1947 through 1951. Multiple faults were revealed after the vehicle entered service. The M44 was withdrawn from mass production due to the development of improved artillery of this class. According to different sources, 250–600 vehicles of this type were manufactured from 1953 through 1954.
16417.name: M44

3457.description: In 1956, production of a modernized variant of the Ikv 102 SPG, designated Ikv 103, was started. These vehicles were designed to provide fire support to infantry. A total of around 80 vehicles were manufactured and remained in service until the early 1980s.
3457.name: Ikv 103

3473.description: A project for a heavy tank developed in 1956 by Richard Lewandowski who was a cadet at the Military Technical Academy of Warsaw. The tank was supposed to weigh 60 tons and feature 200 mm armor. Development was discontinued at the drafting stage.
3473.name: 60TP Lewandowskiego

61969.description:
The first prototypes of the Kanonenjagdpanzer, also known as the Jagdpanzer Kanone 90 mm, were produced in 1960 by the Hanomag and Henschel companies for the FRG. Production continued until 1967. A total of 770 vehicles for the Bundeswehr and 80 for the Belgian Armed Forces were built. However, in 1985, the vehicle was deemed outdated. Some of them were converted into artillery observation vehicles and others were refitted into anti-tank guided missile carriers. Some Kanonenjagdpanzer remained in service until 1990.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
61969.name: Kanonenjagdpanzer

19745.description: A project of an airborne light tank. Developed by the Cadillac company from 1952 through 1956 as a replacement for the M41. In 1956, due to insufficient funds, the project was discontinued in favor of the more promising T92. No prototypes were built.
19745.name: T71 CMCD

15937.description: The most massively produced World War II French light tank. Developed in 1934 on a request from the army for infantry support. A total of 1,630 vehicles were manufactured from 1936 through 1940.
15937.name: Renault R35

66833.description: One of the projects for further developing and modernizing the E 75 tank. There were plans to mount a gas-turbine engine and a shielded cast turret. It existed only in blueprints. This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
66833.name: Rodger Dodger™ E 75 TS

159489.description: Throughout the 1950s and 1960s, the Soviet Union pursued several tank designs that incorporated large-caliber guns in order to more effectively damage enemy tank armor. One such design was the SU-152 Taran. The single prototype, built in 1956, featured a 152.4mm M-69 Taran rifled gun. However, other technologies like the 125mm smoothbore cannon ultimately proved more efficient, and the SU-152 Taran was not produced further.
159489.name: Object 120

1889.description: The Type 4 Chi-To medium tank was developed in 1943 on the basis of the Chi-Nu. The tank was conceived to replace the Chi-Ha. However, mass production was not launched due to a shortage of materials and components. A total of six chassis were produced, and only two tanks were built on their basis.
1889.name: Type 4 Chi-To

13729.description:
The next evolution of an incredible fighter. A trio of nations gave their parts to make the formidable and resilient Trinity Mk. II.
Though great all-rounders, Assault tanks can be at a disadvantage against specialists. They are devastating in groups and can be used to weaken enemy footholds.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
13729.name: The Trinity Mark II

45057.description:
The SU-130PM is a project for a tank destroyer with an open cabin based on the SU-100PM. Unlike its predecessor, this modification featured a more powerful 130 mm gun that required specific changes to be introduced in the vehicle design.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
45057.name: SU-130PM

64561.description:
The development of the 112 tank started in 1962. The project was to feature parts and components of medium and heavy tanks. Existed only in blueprints. The 113 tank was a further development of the 112.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 55% bonus Silver earn.

33873.description:
An Australian tank developed in 1941 on the basis of the U.S. M3 medium tank. Equipped with a 2-pounder gun mounted in a rotating turret, the tank featured a full-cast hull and turret, a low profile and three Cadillac 75 engines. A total of 65 vehicles were manufactured during the war, but production was canceled for economic reasons. Never saw service.
This Premium vehicle has a 50% bonus XP earn and a 26% bonus Silver earn.
33873.name: Vanquisher Sentinel AC I

2369.description:
In 1943, ten FCM36 tanks were converted into tank destroyers. Earlier, twelve vehicles of that type were converted into artillery carrying the 105 mm gun.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
2369.name: FCM 36 PaK 40

61697.description: The prototype of the A-22 hull was produced in 1949. The design incorporated rolled armor plates with maximum slope angles. Test firing showed that the hull was well-protected from high-caliber Armor-Piercing shells. The hull was used as a basis for the project of the T-22 medium tank. Development was discontinued after the preparation of the suspension and general design. Later, the best innovations were applied in the development of the Object 907. This Premium vehicle has a 5% bonus XP earn.
61697.name: T-22 medium

31009.description:
Experimental vehicles T1E4 through T1E6-PS were heavily influenced by the British Vickers E. The first prototype was manufactured by the Cunningham corporation in 1931. After trials in 1932, an upgraded variant was built. However, a different experimental tank, the T2, was preferred.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 45% bonus Silver earn.
31009.name: T1E6-PS

321.description: A further modification of the D1 tank. Developed in 1934 by the Renault company. A total of 100 vehicles were manufactured from 1936 through 1940. The vehicles of the second series were designated as D2bis.
321.name: D2

10577.description: A proposal to mount a 76.2 mm gun on the chassis of the Loyd Carrier artillery truck. Developed from 1940 through 1941. No prototypes were manufactured.
10577.name: Loyd Gun Carriage

4481.description: A contract for the production of a turretless vehicle was concluded with the Bofors company in 1960. A total of 10 prototypes of the 'zero series' were produced. The vehicles differed from the mass-produced Strv 103 in terms of the commander's cupola and its weaker armor and engine. In 1964, the vehicles were used as a basis for the Strv 103A production.
4481.name: Strv 103-0

62993.description:
Heavy tank developed at the end of World War II. The project was designated the Tiger III (VK 45.03) on October 12, 1942. Existed only in blueprints.
This Premium vehicle has a 20% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
62993.name: VK 45.03

16961.description: A variant of the AMX M4 heavy tank based on the Project 141. It was planned to enhance the frontal armor by mounting a 280 mm armor plate. Existed only in blueprints.
16961.name: AMX M4 mle. 54

14097.description: In the winter of 1941–1942, the WaPrüf 6 issued technical requirements for a new 30-ton tank. The orders for development were placed with MAN and Daimler-Benz. The prototypes were to be ready by May 1942. However, on May 13th, 1942, only comparative characteristics of the projects were submitted. The MAN's project was preferred, and the Daimler-Benz's project was canceled.
14097.name: VK 30.01 (D)

195361.description: In 1948, the U.S. Army began development of a new tank to replace the M26 Pershing heavy tank. A total of 1,168 M46 tanks, in two basic variants, were manufactured between 1949 and 1951. Because of its speed, mobility, and 90mm gun, the M46 Patton saw wide use against Soviet-produced vehicles during the Korean War.
195361.name: M46A1 Patton

2913.description: By 1945, the design of the Type 95 Ha-Go was already obsolete. In 1942, the Hino Jidosha company started to develop a new tank, designated the Type 5 Ke-Ho, and a prototype was built in 1944. The design of the tank was similar to that of the Czech LT vz.38 and the Japanese Chi-Ha. However, the vehicle did not go into mass production.
2913.name: Type 5 Ke-Ho

3521.description: In 1966, General Vittorio La Rosa wrote an article in which he outlined his vision of a tank to replace the M60A1 in the Italian Armed Forces, the development and production of which could have been managed by Italian industry. The project existed only in blueprints.
3521.name: Progetto C50 mod. 66

49.description:
This vehicle entered mass production in 1957 at the Baotou Tank Plant, Inner Mongolia, with a total of 6,000 vehicles manufactured by 1987.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 57% bonus Silver earn.
49.name: Type 59

4369.description: Used the "classic" chassis starting with the Ausführung E. Produced from December 1938 through February 1943, a total of 4,958 tanks and 321 command vehicles were manufactured.
4369.name: Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J

13217.description:
Based on a real hybrid created by the French, the Stinger uses American parts to create a fast, agile, and competitive fighter.
Scouts use speed and camouflage to their advantage. Keep moving, and use cover to keep enemies in your team’s sights.
13217.name: Stinger

11521.description: The development of the vehicle was started in 1949 by the Design Bureau of the Chelyabinsk Kirov Plant under the supervision of Joseph Kotin. At the design stage, the vehicle was designated as Object 730. In 1950, a preproduction batch of 10 vehicles was launched. In 1953, before the tank entered service, it was redesignated as the IS-8 and was adopted for service in the second half of that year under the designation T-10. The number of produced vehicles varies from 2,500 to 8,000 according to different sources.
11521.name: T-10

62721.description:
The Kirovets-1 project (IS-3, prototype No. 1) was developed from July through November 1944. The prototype was built at the Chelyabinsk Kirov Plant during September and October 1944. From December 18 through December 24, 1944, the vehicle underwent trials at the NIBT proving grounds in Kubinka. After it was decided to manufacture a pilot series of the modified IS-2 with a hull proposed by engineers of Plant No. 100 and Central Research Institute-48, the work on the Kirovets-1 was discontinued.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
62721.name: Kirovets-1

32033.description:
A light wheeled caterpillar vehicle with machine guns was developed for the U.S. cavalry. Trials of the first prototype started in April 1937 and continued until 1939. However, the T7 was later discontinued in favor of track-type vehicles.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
32033.name: Python T7 Combat Car

1345.description: A cavalry support tank developed in 1934. Mass production was launched in 1935, with a total of 400 vehicles manufactured. In 1938, a new modification, the H38, entered production. About 1,000 of the H35/H38/H39 vehicles were produced.
1345.name: Hotchkiss H35

5505.description: A further development of the UDES 14. The project combined the best elements of the UDES 15 (developed by Bofors) and the UDES 16 (developed by Hägglunds). The project became the main variant of the traditional design for a Swedish tank, but later it was discontinued in favor of a variant with a remotely controlled turret. The full-scale prototype was built, and elements of the vehicle were used in subsequent Swedish projects.
5505.name: UDES 15/16

154881.description: The T-72A model, introduced in 1979, proved to be a major update to the T-72 tank. Improvements included an added laser rangefinder, an electronic fire control, a new side skirt design, smoke grenade dischargers, and ceramic rod composite armor to reinforce the turret. The T-72A remained in production until 1985, with the Soviet Army taking possession of over 5,200 units.
154881.name: T-72A

16385.description: A proposed 122 mm artillery on the basis of the SU-76. No prototypes were built.
16385.name: SU-122A

15121.description: In 1940, German forces captured approximately twenty British Mk. VI tanks. The captured vehicles were used for training purposes until the fall of 1942. In November, it was decided to develop an artillery on the basis of the captured Mk. VI. In 1942, modifications with a 105 mm and 150 mm field howitzer were developed. All these artillery were lost in the defense of France in the summer and fall of 1944.
15121.name: G.Pz. Mk. VI (e)

65313.description:
A Brazilian upgrade of the Walker Bulldog performed by the Bernardini company of Sao Paulo that increased firepower by replacing the original 76 mm gun with a 90 mm Ca 76/90 M32 BR gun. The original gasoline engine was replaced with a Brazilian-built diesel eight-cylinder engine, and it also received an upgraded transmission package to improve its top speed.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 40% bonus Silver earn.
65313.name: M41B Brazilian Bulldog

230657.description:
The T-55 program updated the T-54 main battle tank with a number of improvements. These included a water-cooled diesel engine, vertical and horizontal stabilization for the main gun, an infrared gunner’s searchlight, and perhaps most importantly, nuclear, biological, and chemical (NBC) protection. The T-55A, which featured additional anti-radiation shielding, was considered the final production version; it first appeared in 1963.
This Premium vehicle has a 25% bonus XP, a 10% bonus Crew XP, and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
230657.name: T-55A

3937.description: The Type 5, also known as the Type 2605, was one of the variants of the O-I superheavy tank, developed during World War II. The vehicle was planned to be used for breaking through fortified enemy lines and for coastal defense.
3937.name: Type 5 Heavy

55057.description:
Development of this experimental version of the PzKpfw IV Ausf. G, incorporating hydrostatic drive, began in 1944. Trials were discontinued due to the unreliability of the transmission and the lack of spare parts.
This Premium vehicle has a 40% bonus XP earn and a 40% bonus Silver earn.
55057.name: Pz.Kpfw. IV Hydrostat

47105.description:
The T-34 shielded was one of the projects to improve the armor of the T-34 series tanks. This variant of shielding was developed by the engineers of Research Institute-48 and Plant No. 112 under the supervision of I. Burtsev. During field trials, the armored screen sides were able to withstand fire from 37 mm and 50 mm anti-tank guns, but were penetrated by 88 mm and 75 mm armor-piercing shells. All manufactured prototypes were sent to the front and lost in battle.
This Premium vehicle has a 40% bonus XP earn and a 45% bonus Silver earn.
47105.name: T-34 shielded

55889.description:
The vehicle made famous by the British 7th Armoured Division, dubbed the Desert Rats for their exploits in North Africa. However, the 7th Armoured were not issued with Cromwells until 1944, when they returned to the U.K. to prepare for D-Day. In their Cromwells, they fought their way across France and into Germany, eventually taking part in the Victory Parade on September 7, 1945, in Berlin.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 25% bonus Silver earn.
55889.name: Cromwell B

35921.description:
A modification of the Mk.VI light tank with enhanced armament (the 15 mm Besa machine gun). Produced from December 1939 through July 1940. Initially, the tanks were designed for service in colonies. A total of 130 Mk. VIC tanks were manufactured.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
35921.name: Steadfast Light Mk. VIC

39505.description:
The fighting spirit of an ancient Greek Hero rests until the inevitable return of the Chimera. A variant of the British post-war Centurion Mk. 5 tank with improved frontal armor, machineguns, and a more powerful engine. The vehicle featured a 100-gallon additional armored fuel tank in the rear, and was not provided with screens. The tank saw service in Australian tank units in Vietnam.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
39505.name: Bellerophon Centurion Mk. 5/1 RAAC

48401.description:
The first prototypes of the Kanonenjagdpanzer were produced in 1960 by the Hanomag and Henschel companies for the FRG. Mass production continued until 1967. A total of 770 vehicles for the Bundeswehr and 80 for the Belgian Armed Forces were built. In 1983, the vehicle was deemed outdated. According to engineers, some of them could be equipped with 105 mm guns, but the vehicles were eventually converted into artillery observation vehicles or anti-tank guided missile carriers. The Kanonenjagdpanzer (also known as Jagdpanzer Kanone 90 mm) remained in service in citizen military forces until 1990.
This Premium vehicle has a 15% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
48401.name: Kanonenjagdpanzer 105

33057.description:
A light wheeled caterpillar vehicle with machine guns was developed for the U.S. cavalry. Trials of the first prototype started in April 1937 and continued until 1939. However, the T7 was later discontinued in favor of track-type vehicles.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 30% bonus Silver earn.
33057.name: Kraken T7 Combat Car

52561.description: The development of this assault tank began in 1942. The design was finalized by February 1944, and an order was placed for 25 vehicles. However, by the fall of 1947, only five tanks had been manufactured.
52561.name: Tortoise

3665.description: A British version of the American M4 Sherman tank, developed in early 1944. It differed from the U.S. version by having a more powerful 17-pounder gun, different placement of the radio and ammunition, no bow gun, and no driver's assistant position. Between 2,100 and 2,300 vehicles of all modifications were built from 1944 through 1945.
3665.name: Sherman Firefly

16145.description: A proposed anti-aircraft vehicle based on the Pz.Sfl.IV chassis and mounting the 88 mm anti-aircraft gun. Development started in Germany in 1941. The operational requirements for the vehicle were constantly changed, and the FlaK 41 gun was mounted on the chassis only in 1944. The vehicle was to be the basis of variants with other armament alternatives. However, the plan was never implemented. Only three prototypes were manufactured.
16145.name: Pz.Sfl. IVc

801.description: Developed from 1940 through 1942, with a total of 40 vehicles manufactured from November 1942 through February 1944. It never saw action.
801.name: M6

4961.description: The O-Ho was a further development of the idea of a superheavy tank with improved armor protection. The vehicle had a good set of guns that allowed for all-angle fire. The project was discontinued due to the war ending. No finished prototypes were built and the vehicle never saw action.
4961.name: O-Ho

54785.description:
Developed on the basis of the T-100 heavy tank. The vehicle was intended to neutralize enemy pillboxes and destroy enemy vehicles. The only prototype was manufactured in March 1940. The vehicle never entered mass production.
This Premium vehicle has a 30% bonus XP earn and a 43% bonus Silver earn.
54785.name: SU-100Y

48129.description:
A M4A2(76)W medium tank that in the spring of 1945 was manned by the crew of Dmitriy Loza, a future Hero of the Soviet Union and commander of the 1st Tank Battalion of the 46th Guards Tank Brigade of the 9th Guards Mechanized Corps.
This vehicle has a 35% XP earn bonus and a 22% Silver earn bonus.
48129.name: Loza's M4-A2 Sherman

2305.description: A heavy artillery on the hull of the KV-1S tank, with a total of 671 vehicles built from February through December 1943.
2305.name: SU-152

34081.description:
Experimental vehicles T1E4 through T1E6-X1 were heavily influenced by the British Vickers E. The first prototype was manufactured by the Cunningham corporation in 1931. After trials in 1932, an upgraded variant was built. However, a different experimental tank, the T2, was preferred.
This Premium vehicle has a 70% bonus XP earn and a 45% bonus Silver earn.
34081.name: T1E6-X1

3393.description: Artillery on the basis of the Lorraine 37L. Development was started just before World War II. Existed only in blueprints.
3393.name: Lorraine 39L AM

69137.description: The German army’s interest in developing a heavily armored assault vehicle capable of demolishing well-fortified structures continued into 1943. That year, the manufacturing firm Krupp proposed a design that called for a 30.5cm L/16 siege mortar along with the running gear from a Tiger tank. The 120-ton Bär (“bear” in English) never existed beyond blueprints. However, it is said to have influenced the design of the SturmTiger.
69137.name: Bär

529.description: Development of the Tiger I was started in 1937 by the Henschel company. Mass production began in 1942, with an eventual total of 1,354 vehicles manufactured. The tank first saw combat in the fight for Leningrad, and Tigers were at the forefront of battles from Tunisia to Kursk. Although production was discontinued in the summer of 1944, the Tiger I continued to see action until the end of the war.
529.name: Tiger I

50721.description:
The development of this tank began in 1948. It was supposed to be a vehicle with armament similar to the M46, but with better armor. However, due to its low engine power, the tank had poor mobility. After six prototypes were built, all work on the project was discontinued. Some elements of its turret, gun, and fire control system were later used for the M47.
This premium tank has a 10% bonus XP earn and 50% bonus SIlver earn.
50721.name: T42

4689.description: A modification of the A22 with enhanced armor. The first vehicles of this type were produced just before the Allied landing in Normandy. This model was also the basis for the Churchill Crocodile flame-throwing tank.
4689.name: Churchill VII

34817.description:
An experimental medium tank developed in 1945 on the basis of the T-44 tank. Unlike the T-44, the T-44-100 featured the 100 mm LB-1 gun mounted in a newly designed turret, and slat side armor. Only two vehicles were manufactured.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
34817.name: Volk T-44-100

32513.description:
Developed in the summer of 1944 by the Construction Bureau of the Kirov Plant (Leningrad). In the fall of 1944, the prototype underwent trials, but never entered mass production nor saw service.
This Premium vehicle has a 75% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
32513.name: IS-6 Black Edition

1825.description: Infantry support tank. A total of 696 vehicles were manufactured from 1935 through 1942. The tank saw combat with the U.S. Marines on Guadalcanal. It was withdrawn from service in 1942.
1825.name: M2 Light Tank

48385.description:
Developed on the basis of the experimental T-100 heavy tank. The vehicle was intended to neutralize fortified emplacements and could be used for coastal defense. Work on the project was discontinued at the blueprints stage. The vehicle never entered service.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
48385.name: T-103

5985.description: Developed in 1929. The first Japanese tank with a diesel engine, which served as the main tank in the early 1930s. By the beginning of World War II, the design of the vehicle was already obsolete. Nonetheless, it was widely used until the end of the war. Vehicles of this type last saw action in 1944 in the Philippines.
5985.name: Type 89 I-Go/Chi-Ro

67105.description: Developed from 1951. The advantage of four-track vehicles was the capability to continue moving when two tracks were damaged, as well as to mount a large-diameter turret race ring. After studying the project, Associated Engineers Inc. was requested to develop a second variant with another track drive system, one drive on each side. It existed only in blueprints.  This Premium vehicle has a 5% bonus XP earn.
67105.name: Fangula™ AE Phase 1

3121.description: The first tanks of the M5 series were produced in April 1942, and a new modification, the M5A1, was preferred over other variants. After the M24 Chaffee was developed, the M5A1 tanks were deemed obsolete and were exported to other countries, including China. A total of 100 tanks of this type were supplied to the Kuomintang. During the Civil War (1946–1949), many of these vehicles were captured by the PLA.
3121.name: M5A1 Stuart

257.description: A tank destroyer built on the chassis of the T-34 and SU-122, with a total of 2,329 vehicles produced from August 1943 through October 1944, and 638 SU-122 vehicles built from December 1942 through August 1943.
257.name: SU-85

54609.description:
In 1943, the Montreal Locomotive Works started mass production of the Sexton Artillery, developed on the basis of the RAM II. A total of 2,150 vehicles were produced by 1945, of which 125 were designated as Sexton I.
This Premium vehicle has a 60% bonus XP earn and an 81% bonus Silver earn.
54609.name: Sexton I

3633.description: Soviet IS-2 tanks were exported to China in the early 1950s and were used during the Korean War from 1950 through 1953. According to American reconnaissance data, at least four Chinese tank companies deployed in Korea had the IS-2 tanks, with five tanks in each company. The IS-2 tank was in service until the late 1950s. Production was discontinued due to a shortage of spare parts and the launch of the Type 59 project. A few IS-2 tanks were exported to Vietnam, where they fought in the final stage of the Indochina War of 1946–1954.
3633.name: IS-2

66337.description: Stone Cold Steve Austin version. The design was developed in June 1954. Based on the latest technology and a long development cycle, the vehicle was supposed to replace the M48. Work on the design was carried out until January 1955, and elements of the vehicle were used in the subsequent T95 project. This Premium tank has a 50% bonus Silver earn and a 10% bonus XP earn.
66337.name: Stone Cold Steve Austin TL-1 LPC

67089.description: The Sturmtiger, also called the Sturmmörser, featured a distinct armament: a 38cm gun originally intended for use against enemy submarines. The gun fired rocket-propelled shells, the exhaust from which created so much pressure that a series of ventilation shafts had to be installed from the breech to the gun muzzle. Because the Tiger I chassis was the only chassis strong enough to mount such a gun, and because Tiger tanks were in high demand at the frontlines, only eighteen Sturmtiger vehicles were built, twelve of which were completed and sent into battle.
67089.name: Sturmtiger

51745.description:
Developed on the basis of the M3 and produced in Canada from 1942 through the summer of 1943. None of the 1,849 vehicles were ever used in action, although some were used for training purposes.
This Premium vehicle has a 40% bonus XP earn and a 55% bonus Silver earn.
51745.name: Ram II

5713.description: This upgraded version of the Centurion was developed by Leyland Motors and featured an expanded hull, improved cabin design, larger fuel tanks, and enhanced armor.
5713.name: Centurion Mk. 7/1

18193.description: The most widely produced Pz IV variant, the H version, was developed in 1942. For some time, it was mass-produced along with the Ausf. G. A total of 3,774 tanks of the H version were manufactured.
18193.name: Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H

28225.description:
A series of vehicles developed by BRUNON-VALETTE under the ELC program in the late 1950s. The goal was to create a light aeromobile tank for fire support purposes. The vehicle had small dimensions and high maneuverability. A total of 10 pilot vehicles with different types of armament were produced. They underwent trials, but the vehicle never entered mass production.
This Premium vehicle has a 10% bonus XP earn and a 50% bonus Silver earn.
28225.name: Vanguard ELC EVEN 90

11857.description: A prototype light artillery developed by Vickers. Development began in 1947, but the prototype was not manufactured until 1953. The design of the artillery was already obsolete by this time, and the project was canceled.
11857.name: FV304

4145.description: Development began in 1962 on a new medium tank based on the Type 59. The new tank was expected to feature improvements in firepower and armor protection. However, the project was canceled shortly after. Some technical innovations were applied later, in the development of the Type 69 tank. All 121 tank prototypes were destroyed during Chinese nuclear weapon testing.

38993.description:
